poem:
Title: "The Echoing Halls"

In the chattering heart of Nine, malaise sings,
Invisible hands eroding morale like persistent rings.
Newsroom beasts, thriving on power and dread,
Now, a ceaseless apology, urgently pled. 

A call to do more echoes far and wide,
Bitter harvests from the seeds of impropriety hide.
Shall we learn from the silent, weary stars,
To broadcast truth, just as it is, without scars.
